title: Thistleton Roman Town
description: A small town of the Roman era, with likely Iron Age antecedent and associated farmsteads and field systems, located near and around modern Thistleton, Market Overton, and Kendrew Barracks (the former RAF Cottesmore) in Rutland district, England. This archaeological landscape has been known and explored since at least the 19th century through chance finds, field walking, geophysical prospecting, targeted excavation, and aerial photography.

properties.description: 1:1 million scale representative point location digitized from the Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World by the Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations project at Harvard University.
properties.title: DARMC location 20661
